intro: Campanula glomerata subsp. cervicarioides, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its dense clusters of bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive floral display.
